column4: i'm mapping a network share in fstab, but i've noticed it send the username/password in clear text
does nautilus do this with it's connect to server?
whats the best way to map a windows network share?
nautilus in gutsy is broke, and i usually use "connect to server" to map network shares, but hey they broke that. so now i have to do it through fstab
what's the best protocol to do it?
i as trying cifs but i see it sends passwords in plain text
that's kinda useless?
it's not my share to administer
it's a network share i map over a vpn
What is it connecting to? smb/cifs/windows networking supports a bunch of different authentication methods.
well it's just a windows share on a win2003 box
i want to know what's the most secure way to map it with linux
Hmm. Check the samba documentation, there should be a way to tell it to only use ntlm/ntlmv2
i reckon nautilus smb support does that
but gutsy broke it
and the only way to fix is to get the latest nautilus - not available for gutsy yet#
i could get a .deb but apparently that's not a good idea?
Try adding "client lanman auth = no " to smb.conf and see if that helps.
just out of interest, what would be bad about installing a nautilus .deb that was above the version ubuntu repositories have
:S
It might fail/not work. Should normally not have any really nasty effects since a .deb will most of the time uninstall fine.
but if i insall it over my current nautilus, when i uninstall... i would be without nautilus?
As in, if the new nautilus doesn't work you can uninstall it and reinstall the one from the repositories.
